This game is so popular that there's probably no reason in leaving a review for it. However, if you've never played it I would highly, highly recommend it. Basically anyone can find it fun as long as they can handle standard FPS controls.

If you've avoided it due to the huge and sometimes annoying amount of hype around it, you should definitely give it a try just to see. I also think this game is vastly better than Portal 2, which was a lot more self-aware about the fandom, while this one is more genuine.

I played it only because its a game from half life universe (im fan of half life so i gave portal a chance).
THE CAKE IS A LIE

Despite being one man, the developer of this game really knows what his fans want. On Friday, I had burned my hand with flaming oil and stayed eight straight hours in a neglectful "healthcare" facility that took eight hours to bandage my recently singed flesh. This left me with very limited use of my left hand, thus rendering me unable to play most games as they tend to require two hands. This hero of a developer kept his clientele in mind, and made it so this game could easily be played with one hand. I can tell just by that design choice that this is an upstanding Christian man who had developed a wholesome Christian game. Obviously this game was designed for people with limited mobility such as myself, as I cannot think of any other reason why this game should be played with one hand. These design choices lead me to believe that there is still hope left for humanity, 10/10.
This game helped me learn that I shouldn't trust cake. It's an instructive game. I recommed it

portal

This is one of the greatest games of all time. I initially played this on Xbox, but got it on PC and played through it a few more times. This game has not lost any appeal in the 14 years that it has been released. It never gets too difficult that it distracts from the gameplay, or story. In short, its amazing. It really feels like you are learning everything with Chell. Making the ending so satisfying. It has a special way of making you feel isolated. Even when there is little threat of psychical danger to the player, it still can feel eerie at times. If you have not played this game, please do. It doesn't matter what platform you play it on. It might be a bit easier on PC with the few quick actions that it requires here and there. But its not a huge deal. Xbox, PS4, PC, it doesn't matter.
Its a classic
